intro: Zauschneria velutina, commonly known as the wooly goldcup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant features soft, hairy foliage that gives it a distinctive, velvety appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Zauschneria velutina is valued for its ornamental qualities and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
